moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 d6 5. Bc4 Nf6 6. Nc3 a: preventing the annoying pin on c3 knight.
moves.7. O-O e5 8. Nxc6 bxc6 9. Be3 Bb7 10. Re: Not a great move, If Qxd6 white wins a pawn.
Bait. If Rxd4, then Ra1+ after white blocks with his rooks, it is mate.
moves.30. c3: Bad move. Gives up a free pawn.
moves.30... Rxc3 31. Rxc3 Qxc3 32. Qxf7+: Big Blunder. Gives up a queen and a bishop for a rook and a pawn.
Getthing the f-pawn on a diagonal. Could lead to complications for white.
moves.39. Kf1: Bad move, jeopardizes the white pawns after Qh1+.
moves.39... Qh1+ 40. Ke2 Qxh2 41. Kf3: Another bad move. Gives up the f-pawn for free.
moves.41... Qxf2+ 42. Kg4: Yet another blunder. Gives up the rook for nothing after Qe2+.
Could have ended the game here, however the result will not change due to a missed checkmate. Black is too far ahead.
